title.narrative: CBS CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: 4.1 : By 2018, CBS has capacity to coordinate, analyse and disseminate disaggregated data related to children, adolescents and women in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, government uses disaggregated data for equity-focused social policy development and planning and for reporting on the rights of children and women in humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 : By 2018, CBS has capacity to coordinate, analyse and disseminate disaggregated data related to children, adolescents andwomen in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: In 2021, COVID-19 prevention measures and subsequent restrictions on travel continued, greatly impacting the ability of UNICEF;to conduct programme assurance and monitoring activities especially without international staff presence in Pyongyang. The lack of staff in Pyongyang has also limited engagement with the Central Bureau of Statistics;and postponed planned training and capacity development initiatives. UNICEF has developed various remote monitoring plans with remote monitoring for WASH under implementation through an agreement with the Ministry of Urban Management. ;; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
